intro: Smilax chiriquensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí smilax, is a species of climbing shrub native to Central America. It belongs to the genus Smilax, which includes over 300 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems, which can grow up to several meters in length, and its compound leaves with spiny margins. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by red, fleshy berries. Smilax chiriquensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
